titleStmt.title: J. Stoddard to P. E. Royse
CWG2982

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p:
Elgin July 22d
Rev P E Roycse
Dear Sir

Yours date 18 was duley rescvd and is noted In answer to Your letter consirning Wm Jaques if it be the Same Wm Jaques as I canot doubt in Givin you refr to me Must be ^my^ Wife's brother He left here one Year ago last Feb or March and has never been heard from him Since all Given him up for dead as Nothing was or has been Said of his -- whereabots he gone Wm J was reared and brought up tendrly and well of resp parents in England but Is like Many others
who came to this Cunty Soon Spent all they had in not knowing how to Manage their affairs he is now Cast upon the pub,, for Suport Nothing to help himSelf with and few relations to do any thing for him if they were able as for me myself I cannot do anything at present to help One I have Sent your letter to Mr Godsmak that Marred his Sister in Mch and what will be "the result I cannot Say May be they will write you alSo pleas write Me again

P,, S Revd C Lakey married one of is SiSter they live in your State 20 miles South Clevelad his AddrSSr is
Revd Charles Lakey
Seville Ohio
J,, S
